nullProduct & Service Notifications
Publish Date: Apr 26, 2024
Description
More information on Product and Service Notifications, sent to admins of Salesforce orgs via email, containing transactional communications that may impact their use of Salesforce.
Resolution

Last updated on October 26, 2023.

1. What are Product and Service Notifications?
Product and Service Notifications are communications from the Salesforce Technology Communications & Readiness team sent to admins of Salesforce orgs via email to alert them of any changes to features, functionality, or service that may impact their use of Salesforce. These notifications may include actions admins must take to prepare for these changes.

Product & Service Notifications include:

Major Release Reminders
​Off-Cycle Releases (outside of the 24-hour standard release window)
Product Behavior Change
Service Maintenances
Product & Feature Retirement Notifications & Newsletters
Infrastructure Upgrades & Changes

2. Who is the audience for Product and Service Notifications?
Our target audience is a system administrator who manages changes to Salesforce features, functionality, or services on behalf of their organization. We define an admin as any user with a profile, permission set, or permission set group that has the following permissions enabled below:

Manage Users
Modify All Data

For Marketing Cloud, the permissions are:

Administrator
Marketing Cloud Administrator

Check your profile or ask the system administrator of your Salesforce org to see if you have these permissions enabled.

NOTE: If a change impacts a sandbox org, the admin(s) of the production org associated with the impacted sandbox org will receive the Product and Service Notification.

3. Where can I manage my preferences for Marketing Communications from Salesforce?
https://cloud.mail.salesforce.com/signup

4. Why are these communications important?
If you are an admin of a Salesforce org, receiving these notifications is critical to preparing for changes that may impact your organization. Product and Service Notifications are not marketing emails; they are communications based on your organization’s Salesforce implementation.

5. How often are these communications sent?
Each type of communication has its notification cadence and guidelines. For planned activities, changes, and updates, our goal is to give customers as much notice as possible to prepare for the change, especially if there is an action they need to take. Additionally, reminders may be sent leading up to that change to ensure customers are aware and thoroughly prepared.

6. What email addresses are the Product and Service Notifications sent from?
These communications are sent from: noreply@salesforce.com, alerts@mail.salesforce.com, and techcomms@mail.salesforce.com with the header "Product and Service Notification.”

7. If the admin(s) for my organization works across multiple orgs, will that admin(s) receive multiple notifications for any given Product and Service Notification?
As Product and Service Notifications are sent to targeted customer lists based on whether or not a particular change will impact your organization, admins will receive a Product and Service Notification for each impacted orgs they manage.

For example, if you are an admin for three different orgs (each with a unique orgID), you will receive product and Service Notifications for each of those orgs whenever the org, or your users, are impacted by a change that may require you to take action.

8. Where can I get information about the instance my Salesforce org is on?
Sign up for Trust notifications for your Salesforce instance on our Trust site. If you would like more details about what Trust notifications are and how to subscribe, you can review the Trust Notification User Guide.

9. How can a user resubscribe to get the notifications again?
Open a case with Support via Salesforce Help and request to be unblocked from the product and service notifications. Note that it may take 7+ business days to process.
